Job Title: Wealth Management Senior Associate\/Principal

Location: Indianapolis, IN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Do you have a passion for using your financial planning skills to impact lives? Are you motivated when you can help clients reach their goals? Do you like the challenge of solving the puzzle that can be a client's complex financial picture? Do you have a strong knowledge base that will allow you to explain simple and complex financial solutions to a client? If you answered yes to the questions above, we would like to speak with you about being a Wealth Management Senior Associate or Principal, depending on experience, on our team in our Indianapolis office.

Primary Responsibilities

As a Wealth Management Senior Associate or Principal, you will serve our clients with a range of financial planning services, which require the following responsibilities: 

 Build strong, long-term client relationships. You will work with clients to analyze their current financial health, help set short/long-term financial goals, and design a realistic plan of action. You will proactively provide the following: Goal-based financial planning and cash flow planning using e-Money  Advanced planning, such as estate planning, tax planning, and insurance needs analysis while working with clients’ outside advisors  Coordination of client meetings including materials, agenda, and post-meeting action item follow-up  Answers to clients’ questions with superior service front of mind, always  Provide comprehensive financial advice: You will determine what level of financial plan and support is needed for each client and adjust their level of service accordingly.  Communicate: You must be a superior, proactive communicator who can adjust your message and style to the needs of our clients. You must have a disciplined approach to client follow-up.  Brand Ambassador: Enthusiastically advocate the values, ethics, and unique approach our company takes to personal financial planning.  Data Management: You must maintain all data in Salesforce and follow designated workflows and compliance procedures. 
Qualifications

 Bachelor's degree and/or CFP designation preferred – CPA, JD, CHFC, or EA a plus  6+ years financial planning, estate planning and/or tax planning/preparation experience  Demonstrate strong and effective leadership skills through clear communication and collaboration with others  Strong interpersonal and networking skills with both external clients and internal collaboration  Working knowledge of e-Money, salesforce, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook a strong plus  Ability to listen and empathize with clients, spot, and analyze issues, and simplify/explain financial concepts to provide solutions  Strong attention to detail, exceptional problem-solving skills, and ability to organize and prioritize work in order to meet deadlines in a proactive manner with little supervision required  Must accept and thrive in a fast-paced, changing environment  Ability to build and maintain relationships with potential and current clients  Collaborate with colleagues to present to prospective clients and centers of influence  Tenacious about doing what is right for the client – always 

Company Overview

Cerity Partners is a leading, national registered wealth management and institutional consulting firm serving high-net-worth individuals and their families, businesses and their employees, and nonprofit organizations from its offices across the country. Our in-house experts of attorneys, tax advisors, financial planners and investment professionals are passionate about and committed to providing objective financial advice and oversight.

Our mission is to positively impact the financial well-being of our clients by delivering objective financial advice. Our culture allows us to deliver this mission. We believe in a simple formula that drives our actions and pushes us every day to do better than the day before: People First + Accountability = Winning Outcomes. We expect our team members to deliver on their responsibilities, understand how every component of our company works to generate success, and hold themselves and their colleagues accountable to the highest standards. As a result, we will enjoy talking to you if:

 You understand the need to provide a world-class client experience  You value the collaboration of insightful, experienced colleagues to deliver our services  You demonstrate a strong affinity in financial services, exceptional communication, organization, and prioritization skills

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
